home.text: I’m Margot, a French junior developer and foreign languages enthusiast
home.briefcase: I did a “preparatory class” after high school (a demanding two-year program to prepare the entry exams to France’s top business schools) and was admitted into Audencia. After completing the general curriculum I did an internship in a French “State startup”. It was there that I discovered web development, fell in love with it, and decided to become a developer.
home.code: I started learning how to code on my own in the summer of 2017, then applied to Simplon, a state and EU funded school / social startup. I attended their seven-month web development program (fullstack PHP/JavaScript), then did a two-month internship as a web developer at the startup Brother Tongue.
home.heart: I love roller skating, reading books–especially in English, Spanish and Portuguese, crafting things and discussing social matters (from feminism to social inclusion to education). I look forward to learning new skills, discovering more places and people, and finding my dream job, part software engineer, part project manager.

projects.occ: A collaborative database of all the secondary schools in France that I made for a “State startup”
projects.lexicode: A tool to take and store notes on code-related topics
projects.bt: A language-teaching startup where I worked on the website as an intern
projects.adonis: An application boilerplate for AdonisJs (a Node.js framework), with a React frontend
projects.ovrsea: A digital freight-forwarder where I worked for three months as a fullstack web developer
